wikipedia_page.main: Albert Titley (18 November 1918 – 17 September 1986) was an English footballer who played for West Bromwich Albion, Port Vale, and Macclesfield Town in the 1930s.

response: * 17 September 1986 – Albert Titley, 74, played four league games for Port Vale in the 1930s, having failed to break into the first team at West Bromwich Albion.
